channel.title: CVE Feed for Qualcomm, Inc. -- All Qualcomm products
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Qualcomm, Inc. -- All Qualcomm products

item.title: CVE-2015-9061|2024-08-06T08:36:31.827Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, playReady DRM failed to check a length potentially leading to unauthorized access to secure memory.

item.title: CVE-2015-0575|2024-08-06T04:17:31.680Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, insecure ciphersuites were included in the default configuration.

item.title: CVE-2015-9049|2024-08-06T08:36:31.477Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a vulnerability exists in the processing of certain responses from the USIM.

item.title: CVE-2016-10335|2024-08-06T03:21:50.464Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, libtomcrypt was updated.

item.title: CVE-2015-9037|2024-08-06T08:36:31.770Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a buffer over-read may occur in the processing of a downlink 3G NAS message.

item.title: CVE-2015-9043|2024-08-06T08:36:31.778Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a NULL pointer can be dereferenced upon the expiry of a timer.

item.title: CVE-2015-8595|2024-08-06T08:20:43.287Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a buffer over-read vulnerability exists in digital television/digital radio DRM.

item.title: CVE-2015-9054|2024-08-06T08:36:31.790Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a NULL pointer can be dereferenced during GAL decoding.

item.title: CVE-2016-5855|2024-08-06T01:15:10.744Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In a driver in all Qualcomm products with Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, or QRD Android, a user-supplied buffer is casted to a structure without checking if the source buffer is large enough.

item.title: CVE-2015-9069|2024-08-06T08:36:31.787Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, the Secure File System can become corrupted.

item.title: CVE-2014-9927|2024-08-06T14:02:36.806Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In UIM in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input vulnerability could potentially exist.

item.title: CVE-2015-9044|2024-08-06T08:36:31.771Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a vulnerability exists in LTE where an assertion can be reached due to an improper bound on the size of a frequency list.

item.title: CVE-2014-9967|2024-08-06T14:02:37.300Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, an untrusted pointer dereference vulnerability exists in WideVine DRM.

item.title: CVE-2016-5854|2024-08-06T01:15:10.784Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In a driver in all Qualcomm products with Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, or QRD Android, kernel heap memory can be exposed to userspace.

item.title: CVE-2015-9027|2024-08-06T08:36:31.484Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, an untrusted pointer dereference vulnerability exists in WideVine DRM.

item.title: CVE-2015-9050|2024-08-06T08:36:31.528Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a vulnerability exists where an array out of bounds access can occur during a CA call.

item.title: CVE-2015-9021|2024-08-06T08:36:31.802Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, access control to SMEM memory was not enabled.

item.title: CVE-2016-10391|2024-08-06T03:21:51.308Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, the length in an HCI command is not properly checked for validity.

item.title: CVE-2015-9026|2024-08-06T08:36:31.558Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, an untrusted pointer dereference vulnerability exists in WideVine DRM.

item.title: CVE-2015-9036|2024-08-06T08:36:31.664Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, an incorrect length is used to clear a memory buffer resulting in adjacent memory getting corrupted.

item.title: CVE-2016-5858|2024-08-06T01:15:10.743Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In an ioctl handler in all Qualcomm products with Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, or QRD Android, if a user supplies a value too large, then an out-of-bounds read occurs.

item.title: CVE-2015-9047|2024-08-06T08:36:31.483Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a vulnerability exists in GNSS when performing a scan after bootup.

item.title: CVE-2014-9411|2024-08-06T13:40:25.203Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, the use of an out-of-range pointer offset is potentially possible in rollback protection.

item.title: CVE-2015-9023|2024-08-06T08:36:31.644Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the PlayReady API.

item.title: CVE-2014-9941|2024-08-06T14:02:37.310Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In the Embedded File System in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a Time-of-Check Time-of-Use Race Condition vulnerability could potentially exist.

item.title: CVE-2016-10389|2024-08-06T03:21:51.409Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, there is no size check for the images being flashed onto the NAND memory in their respective partitions, so there is a possibility of writing beyond the intended partition.

item.title: CVE-2015-9067|2024-08-06T08:36:31.560Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a potential compiler optimization of memset() is addressed.

item.title: CVE-2016-10388|2024-08-06T03:21:51.423Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a configuration vulnerability exists when loading a 3rd-party QTEE application.

item.title: CVE-2014-9965|2024-08-06T14:02:37.419Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a vulnerability exists in the parsing of an SCM call.

item.title: CVE-2015-9060|2024-08-06T08:36:31.663Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a pointer is not properly validated in a QTEE system call.

item.title: CVE-2014-9936|2024-08-06T14:02:37.305Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In TrustZone a time-of-check time-of-use race condition could potentially exist in an authentication routine in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel.

item.title: CVE-2016-10237|2024-08-06T03:14:42.879Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: If shared content protection memory were passed as the secure camera memory buffer by the HLOS to a trusted application (TA) in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, the TA would not detect an issue and it would be treated as secure memory.

item.title: CVE-2014-9930|2024-08-06T14:02:36.690Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In WCDMA in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a Use After Free vulnerability could potentially exist.

item.title: CVE-2014-9961|2024-08-06T14:02:37.330Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a vulnerability in eMMC write protection exists that can be used to bypass power-on write protection.

item.title: CVE-2015-9035|2024-08-06T08:36:31.806Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a memory buffer fails to be freed after it is no longer needed potentially resulting in memory exhaustion.

item.title: CVE-2015-9001|2024-08-06T08:36:30.971Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In TrustZone an information exposure vulnerability can potentially occur in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel.

item.title: CVE-2015-8999|2024-08-06T08:36:31.537Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In TrustZone a buffer overflow vulnerability can potentially occur in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel while loading an ELF file.

item.title: CVE-2014-9924|2024-08-06T14:02:36.635Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In 1x in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a Signed to Unsigned Conversion Error could potentially occur.

item.title: CVE-2016-10343|2024-08-06T03:21:50.889Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, sSL handshake failure with ClientHello rejection results in memory leak.

item.title: CVE-2014-9951|2024-08-06T14:02:37.754Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In TrustZone in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, an Information Exposure Through Timing Discrepancy vulnerability could potentially exist.

item.title: CVE-2015-9053|2024-08-06T08:36:31.802Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the processing of certain responses from the USIM.

item.title: CVE-2016-10382|2024-08-06T03:21:51.331Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, access control to the I2C bus is not sufficient.

item.title: CVE-2014-9977|2024-08-06T14:02:37.602Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a buffer overflow vulnerability exists in PlayReady DRM.

item.title: CVE-2014-9979|2024-08-06T14:02:37.311Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a variable is uninitialized in a TrustZone system call potentially leading to the compromise of secure memory.

item.title: CVE-2014-9948|2024-08-06T14:02:37.392Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In TrustZone in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, an Improper Validation of Array Index vulnerability could potentially exist.

item.title: CVE-2015-9039|2024-08-06T08:36:31.635Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a vulnerability exists in eMBMS where an assertion can be reached by a sequence of downlink messages.

item.title: CVE-2014-9973|2024-08-06T14:02:37.430Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, validation of a buffer length was missing in a PlayReady DRM routine.

item.title: CVE-2015-9003|2024-08-06T08:36:31.025Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In TrustZone a cryptographic issue can potentially occur in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel.

item.title: CVE-2015-8998|2024-08-06T08:36:31.259Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In TrustZone an integer overflow vulnerability can potentially occur in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel.

item.title: CVE-2016-5871|2024-08-06T01:15:10.416Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, an integer overflow to buffer overflow vulnerability exists when loading an image file.

item.title: CVE-2015-9068|2024-08-06T08:36:31.814Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, an argument to a mink syscall is not properly validated.

item.title: CVE-2016-5863|2024-08-06T01:15:10.795Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In an ioctl handler in all Qualcomm products with Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, or QRD Android, several sanity checks are missing which can lead to out-of-bounds accesses.

item.title: CVE-2016-10341|2024-08-06T03:21:50.843Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, 3rd party TEEs have more privilege than intended.

item.title: CVE-2016-5860|2024-08-06T01:15:10.801Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In an audio driver in all Qualcomm products with Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, or QRD Android, if a function is called with a very large length, an integer overflow could occur followed by a heap buffer overflow.

item.title: CVE-2016-10334|2024-08-06T03:21:50.892Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a dynamically-protected DDR region could potentially get overwritten.

item.title: CVE-2015-9031|2024-08-06T08:36:31.685Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a TZ memory address is exposed to HLOS by HDCP.

item.title: CVE-2015-8996|2024-08-06T08:36:31.338Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In TrustZone a time-of-check time-of-use race condition could potentially exist in a QFPROM routine in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel.

item.title: CVE-2014-9944|2024-08-06T14:02:37.298Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In the Secure File System in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, an Integer Overflow to Buffer Overflow vulnerability could potentially exist.

item.title: CVE-2016-10346|2024-08-06T03:21:50.459Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, an integer overflow vulnerability exists in the hypervisor.

item.title: CVE-2014-9960|2024-08-06T14:02:37.385Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the PlayReady API.

item.description: In TrustZone access control policy may potentially be bypassed in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel due to improper input validation an integer overflow vulnerability leading to a buffer overflow could potentially occur and a buffer over-read vulnerability could potentially occur.

item.title: CVE-2014-9950|2024-08-06T14:02:37.369Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In Core Kernel in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, an Improper Authorization vulnerability could potentially exist.

item.title: CVE-2016-10336|2024-08-06T03:21:50.872Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, some regions of memory were not protected during boot.

item.title: CVE-2014-9933|2024-08-06T14:02:37.362Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: Due to missing input validation in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, HLOS can write to fuses for which it should not have access.

item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a vulnerability exists in LTE where an assertion can be reached due to an improper bound on a length in a System Information message.

item.title: CVE-2016-10383|2024-08-06T03:21:50.882Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, there is a TOCTOU race condition in Secure UI.

item.description: A PKCS#1 v1.5 signature verification routine in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel may not check padding.

item.title: CVE-2014-9935|2024-08-06T14:02:36.735Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In TrustZone an integer overflow vulnerability leading to a buffer overflow could potentially occur in a DRM routine in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel.

item.description: In TrustZone in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, an Improper Authorization vulnerability could potentially exist.

item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, validation of buffer lengths was missing in Keymaster.

item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, stack protection was not enabled for secure applications.

item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, kernel stack data can be leaked to userspace by an audio driver.

item.description: In HDR in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input vulnerability could potentially exist.

item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a QTEE system call fails to validate a pointer.

item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a string can fail to be null-terminated in SIP leading to a buffer overflow.

item.description: In TrustZone in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, an Information Exposure vulnerability could potentially exist.

item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a vulnerability exists in LTE where an assertion can be reached while processing a downlink message.

item.description: In Resource Power Manager (RPM) in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, an Improper Access Control vulnerability could potentially exist.

item.description: In TrustZone in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a Time-of-Check Time-of-Use Race Condition vulnerability could potentially exist.

item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, an untrusted pointer dereference vulnerability exists in the unlocking of memory.

item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, an integer overflow vulnerability exists in debug functionality.

item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, there was an issue related to RPMB processing.

item.description: In a sound driver in Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android, some variables are from userspace and values can be chosen that could result in stack overflow.

item.description: In QSEE in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel access control may potentially be bypassed due to a page alignment issue.

item.description: In TrustZone in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a Double Free vulnerability could potentially exist.

item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, an untrusted pointer dereference can occur in a TrustZone syscall.

item.description: In Boot in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a Use of Uninitialized Variable vulnerability could potentially exist.

item.description: In an audio driver function in all Qualcomm products with Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, or QRD Android, some parameters are from userspace, and if they are set to a large value, integer overflow is possible followed by buffer overflow. In another function, a missing check for a lower bound may result in an out of bounds memory access.
